job_description: In this role, the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst serves as the primary bridge through the business to communicate high value information to support data-driven decision-making. Develop and provision of BI reporting through the deployment of self-service reports and dashboards Engages with business users as well as maintain a client relationship with data warehouse. Deploy Machine learning techniques to answer the appropriate business questions using R or Python. Visualize data using Tableau and create repeatable visual analysis for end users to use as tools. Take ownership of the existing BI platforms and maintain the data integrity and accuracy of the numbers and data sources. Know Agile - Scrum project management experience/knowledge - Ability to prioritise, pushback and effectively manage a product and sprint backlog.

job_title: Engineering, Client Experience, Client Onboarding Tech, Regional Lead, Executive Director (48515)
job_description: What We Do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.  Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.  Who We Look For Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. The Operations Division is the engine room that powers Goldman Sachs, and Operations Technology is driving their industrialization through automation, digitization and orchestration. Client Onboarding Technology is a global, multi-disciplinary team responsible for software products that safely, efficiently, and transparently bring new client relationships into the firm and ensure those relationships remain compliant with all internal and external regulatory policies and firm requirements. Partnering with colleagues from Technology, the Federation and all revenue divisions, COB Tech models all processes from inception through configured-to-trade. Using business intelligence gathered from these models, the team identifies and resolves bottlenecks in the flow though automation - including rules-driven decision making, machine learning, and natural language parsing. The successful candidate will assume responsibility for the regional team of developers and project managers in Singapore and work with stakeholders from both the local and global teams to deliver commercial solutions. There will also be opportunities to assume technical responsibility for design and development of one of our flagship products. HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL • Support the firm's growth by reducing the time required to successfully onboard a new business relationship • Improve customer satisfaction by reducing the number of touchpoints required to successfully onboard a new relationship. • Mitigate risk by fully understanding, modelling, and satisfying all required regulatory and compliance policies. • Thrill our internal stakeholders by rapidly and correctly delivering the most important features using iterative development and automated testing. • COB Tech is a new and growing team. You will have the opportunity to influence team structure, processes, and architecture. Motivated candidates will have immediate opportunities to assume responsibility for as much as they can handle and accelerate their careers accordingly.

job_title: Transportation and Freight Solution (IT) Consultant – Asia Pacific
job_description: This position requires operational and technical expertise and knowledge of Transport/Freight Management Systems (TMS/FMS) supporting the service/sector/solution.  This individual is accountable for functionally supporting comprehensive and complex IT work streams in regional and global projects of Transport/Freight Management Systems from inception to delivery including planning and design. This resource interacts with internal and external customers, CEVA IT department managers, and various technical teams.  The resource uses consultative skills to drive project momentum, manage expectations/risks, communicate effectively, and represents the business in technical meetings. The resource will also ideally be able to derive business intelligence solutions to assist the business and operations in better decision making.  Subject Matter Expert in the TMS/FMS application(s) and related processes.  Provide system demonstrations as needed to Sr. Management or customer executives. Manage TMS projects from inception through delivery ensuring completion of the project objectives on schedule and within budget constraints. Manage a pipeline of Change requests and solutioning work for the FMS Space. Develop detailed project charter and plan (goals, objectives, strategy, scope, budget, scheduling, risk mitigation strategies, contingency plans, approach, requirements, deliverables, timelines, work breakdown structures, use case, test case, and training needs) utilizing project management disciplines and methodologies including process analysis, mapping and flow charting to ensure synchronization of processes and systems. Perform the role of a TMS/FMS Functional Consultant, capture business requirements in detail and then translate in to a Functional Design Document. Able to configure TMS system to suit the business rules, able to on-board customers onto the FMS platform. Engage key stakeholders, define and coordinate activities, communicate changes and progress, build commitment, overcome resistance, implement change management and lead the project team. Conduct regularly scheduled project briefings regarding status, issues, and challenges with all levels of business unit, business sponsors and management for all projects and implementations. Define and derive business intelligence solutions, creating dashboards on Tableau as needed to help the business in decision making. Provide mentoring and guidance to develop other team members, including training and knowledge transfer. Responsible for all administrative activities for the team.

job_description: The Trading Operations Manager is responsible in for executing trades from contract conclusion by the Trading teams to cash collection: 1. Delivering seamless and effective delivery of excellent service to LHT business partners (customers, ship owners/brokers, suppliers) in a timely manner; 2. Ensuring integrity of information flows to and from internal and external stakeholders; 3. Managing risks under the responsibility and guidance of the Trading teams within the defined segregation of duties; 4. Adding value by proposing improvements to the Trading teams and by integrating customer’s feedback to improve LHT value proposition to customers.    MAIN ACTIVITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES    Business objectives    Manage the value creation for and with existing customers and suppliers for the whole LHT perimeter characterized by activities such as: ● Ensuring smooth and seamless execution of trades administration with LHT business partners by driving supply chain schedules and daily updates directly with suppliers, customers, ship owners/brokers, port agents and other stakeholders; ● Ensure and track that cargo and shipping commitments are fulfilled and escalate any potential performance issues to the various internal stakeholders (Traders, Shipping, Legal, Management). ● Ensuring the integrity, timeliness and quality of the information provided to internal and external stakeholders through internal checks and controls (e.g. get approval before loading from CFO and HOT in case of missing LC, non back-to-back positions, provisions, etc);   ● Obtain, issue documentary/shipping instructions with the various stakeholders (suppliers, customers, banks, ship owner/brokers, etc…) and organize surveyors, inspection, etc. where required. ● Ensure nomination and timely acceptance of vessel in close coordination with the Chartering Managers/Shipping dept.; ● Ensure that all measures of mitigation are in place to avoid any risks, disruptions, losses related to vessel operations/trade execution; ● Is responsible for the issuance and control of any laytime calculations and claims with ship owners, suppliers and customers; ● Initiating cash in – cash out processes at transactional level upstream from Finance; ● Prepare reports, statistics for the Team Leaders, Traders or other internal stakeholders when required. ● Escalate any operational issues to 1. Priority: the Team Leader 2. Priority: relevant Trader and/or Chartering Manager; ● Share internally any market/business intelligence collected thru daily interaction with customers and suppliers. ● Collect and forward customer inquiries to the relevant Trader.    Risk management    He/she ensures: ● His/her adherence to the LafargeHolcim Code of Business Conduct, Trading Policy and Shipping Directive and all relevant LafargeHolcim policies.   ● Protection of the LafargeHolcim Group reputation and brand value for relevant seaborne trading activities. ● Anticipation, mitigation and resolution of trade incidents under the Trading team’s guidance, providing suggestions on mitigations strategies; ● Alerts to Team Leader and/or Traders/Charterers in case of material risk (e.g. missing LC, claims), deviance from the delegation of authority or any risk of breach of applicable Policies, in line with LHT’s segregation of duties.

job_description: JOB SUMMARY The Data Scientist II is an intermediate level statistical analyst well versed in various analytical disciplines, such as linear and constraint programming, modeling, simulation, time series analysis, text analytics, multivariate analysis, and other various predictive analytics techniques. This role will have experience querying and analyzing large data sets using traditional structured data base tools and “big data” tools for unstructured data to generate actionable insights and solutions.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ●         Work as part of a data science/business intelligence team to produce advanced predictive model and statistical engines for input to key business applications. ●         Identifies and analyzes patterns in the volume of data supporting the initiative, the type of data (e.g., images, text, clickstream or metering data) and the speed or sudden variations in data collection. ●         Educates the organization both from IT and the business perspectives on new approaches, such as testing hypotheses and statistical validation of results. Helps the organization understand the principles and the math behind the process to drive organizational buy-in. ●         Works with IT teams to support data collection, integration, and retention requirements based on the input collected with the business. ●         Demonstrates a commitment to customer service; anticipates, meets, and exceeds expectations by solving problems quickly and effectively; making customer issues a priority. ●         Build dashboards as well as bespoke, custom analysis. ●         Work on teams with business/functional stakeholders to help make data driven decisions ●        Conducts advanced data analysis and complex designs algorithm.
